intro: Cremanthodium liangshanicum, commonly known as the Yunnan cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
